medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset left sided abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced sudden onset severe left upper quadrant abdominal pain that woke him from sleep this morning. The pain was described as sharp/stabbing and constant, radiating up and down the left abdomen and around to the left flank and back. The patient reported associated chest pain with a pressure/squeeze/burning sensation. Symptoms worsened with nausea after initial presentation, and he experienced a loss of consciousness for approximately one minute after trying to move his bowels. The patient denied dizziness, chest pain, or palpitations prior to this event.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Dilated cardiomyopathy, hypothyroidism, depression, attention deficit disorder, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).
medical_history.family_history: Breast cancer, hypothyroidism, asthma, and hyperthyroidism.
